experience: You and Ryan both know Mo Masoud, Christine Hartnett, and 1 other
Took a bit of time off studying for the CCIE to complete some training with Sangoma.  Apparently I still have some of my voice skills.

Served as liaison between NSG and Nashville’s fastest growing businesses. First and foremost I was a dedicated high-end technical resource that ensured clients of NSG received best-in-class customer service, strategic IT solutions, and services that drive productivity. Served as a “total resource” acting as the Director/Systems Administrator for a specific set of clients. The second largest component of this role was lead generation and sales. While working in the field, it was imperative that I formed long, trusting bonds with our clients. This role also involved management, assigning work to the engineers and overseeing IT operations to ensure the engineer finished the job to completion.

Served as escalation point for Support Engineers and performed all on-site, client facing work. This role required the constant development of relationships with clients both new and long standing. Involved acting as the face of the company and always performing conscientious to the client’s need. Work with project managers to complete long-term projects both on and off-site. Diagnosing and resolving hardware and software issues in an efficient and timely manner. Create and provide innovative solution to complex technical problems. Plan, coordinate, and implement network security measures to protect data. Identify, predict, interpret, and evaluate current and future system and network requirements. Maintain and administer computer networks, including hardware, firewalls, software, applications, and inventory management. Position involves the ability to constantly adapt and troubleshoot/install new technology while documenting procedures for future technicians. Work towards hitting monthly hour goal of billing while documenting every aspect of day-to-day work.

Acted as the first point of contact for clients who needed support. Clients ranged from private businesses, labor unions, law firms, and more.  Worked directly with customers on a technical basis to quickly and effectively restore 100% functions related to all technology. Diagnose d hardware and software problems and replaced defective components in a cost effective and efficient manner. Managed web based queue of tickets. Performed client facing onsite technical work to cover overflow for onsite resources. Remotely supported clients via remote software for ranges of issues. Immediately responded to crypto attacks or other malicious attacks on workstations or servers. Participated in 24x7 on call rotations. Performed monthly backup test restores on both local and cloud based systems. Deployed and maintained monitoring agents and participated in daily checks. Responded with action to any monitoring alert that came into the queue during the day.  Supported a diverse catalogue of applications for different types of businesses & organizations. Worked with senior resources to complete projects and long term goals

Served as member of 230th Signal Company in Nashville, TN. During this time, 25L school was completed with 3M certifications in fiber optics and splicing technologies. Deployed to Afghanistan and served as night shift NCOIC of the Camp Marmal Help Desk from February 2011 - March 2012.

Served on a mobile support team that traveled and supported multiple compounds in Afghanistan to include DEA, FBI, Camp Suitor, Camp Alvarado, Camp Heath, Camp Green, OGA (Other Government Agency), MCTF (Major Crime Task Force), and Camp Phoenix. Installed, configured, and maintained Active Directory (AD), DHCP, Exchange, SCCM, workstations, file servers, fiber runs, & microwave radio shots for the assigned Department of Defense & Department of State computer networks. Was directly responsible for hand receipts & items worth over $10 million of IT equipment, and other mission essential items. Laid copper & fiber optic to ensure connectivity in all buildings on each respective base. Worked directly with Special Agents & other government officials ensuring all of their needs were met. Monitored and managed system resources, including storage disk usage, tape backup systems, and response times to maintain operating efficiency. Performed system backups and recovery procedures.

Provided comprehensive help desk support for problems and service requests related to supported hardware, software, network connectivity and application support for the largest base in Afghanistan with a user base of over 50,000 people. Trained multiple Help Desk Administrators to understand processes, policies and resolutions specific to SWA network. Maintained, created, and modified user, computer, security and distribution objects via active directory. Provided Microsoft Exchange support by moving mailboxes, recognizing exchange issues and resolving problems quickly. Installed, configured, and troubleshot various legacy and enterprise software/hardware. Assisted Help Desk personnel with difficult customer questions and ensured high quality feedback. Tracked all work through with Remedy ticketing system. Managed Help Desk queue for new, priority and VIP tickets to be processed. Provided Network Outage reporting, tracking and resolution verification. Worked directly with the military, training, and assisting the soldiers of our helpdesk to bridge the gap between civilians and our military counterparts.

Served as night shift NCOIC of the Camp Marmal help desk. Responsibilities involved help desk duties relating to active directory and server maintenance. Managed soldiers while ensuring civilian contractors were meeting Army standards. While not working in the help desk I also assisted with fiber optic runs and long term projects.

September 21, 2017, Ryan reported directly to Zachary (Zac)

I have had the pleasure of working with Zac in two different capacities. The first time I was a Systems Engineer while he was in a CRM position. Zac was always extremely professional to work with and always made the clients feel at ease. He has an amazing ability to bridge the gap between technology and client management. When I eventually made the career change into CRM and joined his team, Zac went out of his way to make sure that I was trained properly. Zac has the uncanny ability to see big picture, even when the people around him do not. His experience with Business Development is almost unrivaled in the current market. While acting as my mentor, I was constantly blown away by his ability to remember the small personal details of everyone he encountered, making it easy for him to call anyone a friend. I would recommend Zac for any management, business development, sales, or client management position.
